ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned how to identify solfege, types of Irish trad music, and read sheet music notation
Different Irish Trad dance genres, pop song chord loops, solfege, saraliswarams, identifying key signatures, intervals of fifths, different clefs.
I learned how to understand Solfge symbols and got a bunch of practice singing. I got a better understanding on how far apart different Solfge can be from each other.
learned basic music theory, which was really fun even though i could already read music. it's really helpful, actually.
A nice refresher on music theory! Skills include music transcription, sight reading, identification of keys and meters.

Solfge, basic voice leading, how to read sheet music, triads, identifying tactus and probation in Irish trad music, semitones, different types of scales (pentatonic, diatonic, etc.), key signatures, etc.
musical skills!
Basic music theory: key signatures, clefs, notations, meters and rhythms, intervals and chords. And Irish dancing!!
I gained a deeper understanding of music theory topics such as triads and chords.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Strength: the material is very accessible for people with no music experience yet also engaging for people with some experience. The classes themselves were quite fun and interactive. Weakness: needed more homework assignments for students to actually retain and understand the information. There was practically no hw after a few weeks in
I would've liked to have learned more boring music theory to be honest, but I enjoyed the course more this way. Making us sing is both a strength and a weakness in my opinion.
i feel liek we needed more quizzes in the class to check our learning, but other than that it was easy going and fun.

Weaknesses: Posed as a music theory class, most sessions were solely centered around singing. 
Strengths: A fun class that always keeps you on your toes! From singing to dancing to learning theory about popular songs.

It felt like a very Mr. Miyagi style of teaching because for the first half of the course we basically just sat there and clapped and hummed in a group. But then the second half of the course it was like, surprise youve been learning these things all along! It was cool. I think this was a strength but it also made the class feel rushed at the end and it made the class feel less organized.
love the prof!!
This course is very engaging and fun which involves a lot of singing in class, but I feel like our ability to transcribe melody and sightread could be emphasized more.
I think the level of participation in this course is a major strength, I would've liked to work more in a smaller group however.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Definitely! This course is a great way to get your feet wet with music theory, but if you are looking to gain super in-depth knowledge, this course might be a tad too trivial
I thought it was a fun class - but not everyone would find it fun so it really depends on what you want. If you don't like singing, then stay away.
yes! if you're looking for a gut but you're also willing to learn something completely new, go for it.
Yes! Take this class to balance your schedule, it truly teaches you the fundamentals about music while acting as a de-stressing course

This is a nice course for people who want to learn how to read music (and we did a lot of singing). Id recommend it for people who enjoy listening to music (because we also analyzed songs) and singing. The way the course is taught will likely depend on the professor.

Yes. This class is super fun, I always looked forward to going every week. I originally took it as a 5th class to fill my schedule that looked like a gut, but I ended up loving it and am taking more music classes in the spring (maybe even major in music? Well see). Its fascinating stuff. And its no workload whatsoever snd Professor Quinn is an awesome professor so if you have the chance you should 100% take this class.
yes!! pair it with lessons!
Yes. It is an excellent course that introduces studnets to the music theory realm.
I thoroughly enjoyed this course and would recommend it to anyone that enjoys music.
